series.short_description: Introduces the boss and staff of the Dunder-Mifflin paper company in Scranton.
series.name: Pilot
series.description: Michael Scott is the regional manager of Dunder Mifflin, a failing paper supply firm in Scranton, Pennsylvania. Also working there are Dwight Schrute (assistant to the regional manager), Jim Halpert, a salesman and Pam Beesly, the receptionist.

series.short_description: Michael’s off color remark puts a sensitivity trainer in the office for a presentation.
series.name: Diversity Day
series.description: When Michael imitates a Chris Rock comedy routine, many people in the office are offended, prompting corporate to send in a sensitivity worker to give the Scranton office a diversity training day.

series.short_description: Michael leaves Dwight in charge of picking the new healthcare plan for the staff.
series.name: Health Care
series.description: When Michael is forced to pick a low-grade health care plan for his employees, he tells Dwight to do it for him. When Dwight chooses an extraordinarily bad plan for the Scranton Branch, the workers complain and Michael hides in his office.

series.short_description: Just for a laugh, Jim agrees to an alliance with Dwight regarding the downsizing rumors.
series.name: The Alliance
series.description: Since the rumors of downsizing have occurred in the Scranton branch, Dwight thinks its best to secretly partner with Jim to have each others backs on it, while Jim takes this as an opportunity to have this as one of his pranks against Dwight.

series.short_description: Michael and his staff challenge the warehouse workers to a basketball game.
series.name: Basketball
series.description: The office staff play a basketball game against the warehouse workers in which Jim shows off to impress Pam and upstage her fiancee who is on the opposing team.

series.short_description: Michael start’s vying for the attention of an attractive saleswoman.
series.name: Hot Girl
series.description: When a purse saleswoman enters the office to sell her purses, she gets declined, but when Michael lays his eyes upon her, he decides she can stay at the office and sell her purses to the workers there. But not only Michael has his eyes on her.

series.short_description: Very much unlike his staff, an overeager Michael can’t wait for this year’s annual Dundies awards.
series.name: The Dundies
series.description: The time comes for the annual Dundies Awards to award everyone in the office with their fine work with odd categories. Created my Michael, he is overly excited for it while everyone else couldn’t care less.

series.short_description: The office reviews its sexual harassment policy in light of explicit e-mails.
series.name: Sexual Harassment
series.description: Michael Scott’s “BFF” Todd Packer offends the staff with crude gossip about an upper management scandal. Toby Flenderson informs Michael that he will conduct a review of the company’s sexual harassment policies.

series.short_description: Michael is away with Dwight while Jim rallies the staff together for office games.
series.name: Office Olympics
series.description: While Michael Scott leaves with Dwight Schrute to sign closing papers for his new condominium, the staff fills out their expense reports. Jim Halpert “dies” of boredom, and Pam Beesly revives him by calling him to the reception desk.

series.short_description: A fire in the kitchen relegates the staff to the parking lot as help is on its way.
series.name: The Fire
series.description: Pam learns that Jim and Katy (Amy Adams) have started dating. Michael gives Ryan a glowing checkpoint review. When Ryan expresses his interest in starting his own business someday, Michael takes it upon himself to teach Ryan.

series.short_description: Michael is pressured by corporate to fire someone, which puts a damper on the office Halloween party.
series.name: Halloween
series.description: Although informed early in October that he must fire somebody by the end of the month, Michael Scott waits until the last day of the month, Halloween, and still hasn’t fired anyone. Meanwhile, Jim and Pam post Dwight résumé on the internet.

series.short_description: Jim rallies the staff together to witness a showdown between Michael and Dwight at Dwight’s martial arts school.
series.name: The Fight
series.description: Michael Scott has one task: sign routine documents. Unfortunately, it’s a month where three separate sets of paperwork are due at the same time, so Michael mulishly ignores his workload.

series.short_description: With Michael and Jan Levinson-Gould away from the office to land a new client.
series.name: The Client
series.description: Michael Scott and Jan Levenson meet with a potential client, Christian, at Chili’s. Jan is disgusted with Michael’s antics and refusal to talk business, but discovers at the end of the day that there is a method to his madness.

series.short_description: Michael uses their annual review time to gather feedback on his “relationship” with Jan.
series.name: Performance Review
series.description: Michael Scott meets with each of his employees to discuss their job performance. He plunders the employee suggestion box for ideas to impress his own boss, Jan Levinson, but the ruse backfires and he embarrasses himself.

series.short_description: Michael decides to set up e-mail surveillance for all company e-mail.
series.name: E-Mail Surveillance
series.description: Dunder Mifflin’s tech support employee, Sadiq, arrives at the Scranton branch to set up a system that allows Michael Scott to monitor his employees’ emails. When everyone in the office finds out.

series.short_description: Seeing the party is headed for disastrous boredom, Michael breaks corporate policy to buy alcohol for the staff.
series.name: Christmas Party
series.description: The office staffers hold a “Secret Santa” gift exchange at their Christmas party. Jim Halpert received Pam Beesly’s name, and puts a great deal of effort into getting her the perfect gift.

series.short_description: The Dunder Mifflin staff go on a mandatory “booze cruise” to hear Michael give a motivational talk.
series.name: Booze Cruise
series.description: The Dunder Mifflin crew goes on a cruise on a Lake Wallenpaupack ship Princess in January. Michael Scott plans to use the cruise as both a party and a leadership training exercise.

series.short_description: Michael’s “injury” from a George Foreman Grill distracts the staff from Dwight, the one with the real injury.
series.name: The Injury
series.description: Michael Scott accidentally burns his foot while grilling bacon on his George Foreman Grill, which he keeps next to his bed. After he makes a distress call to the office, Dwight Schrute comes to “rescue” him.

series.short_description: Jim fears the secret he told to Michael, in confidence, will be revealed to the staff.
series.name: The Secret
series.description: Out of fear that Michael Scott will tell the others he has feelings for Pam Beesly, Jim Halpert allows Michael to believe that they are best friends, which leads to an awkward lunch at Hooters paid for with a corporate credit card.

series.short_description: Michael’s office becomes the victim of an odorous prank which subjects the office to his punishment.
series.name: The Carpet
series.description: When someone leaves a disgusting substance on the carpet in Michael Scott’s office, he spends the day at Jim Halpert’s desk, relegating Jim to the back room (referred to as the “Annex”) to suffer Kelly Kapoor’s constant chattering.

series.short_description: Jan comes into the Scranton Branch to give all the female employees a group seminar on women in the workplace.
series.name: Boys and Girls
series.description: Jan Levinson leads the female Dunder Mifflin employees in a “women in the workplace” seminar. Miffed at being excluded, Michael Scott conducts a competing men in the workplace seminar in the warehouse.

series.short_description: Back in Scranton, the office staff celebrates Valentine’s Day grade school style.
series.name: Valentine’s Day
series.description: Before a Valentine’s Day meeting at the corporate offices in New York City with Jan Levinson and the new CFO David Wallace, Michael Scott accidentally lets slip to the other branch managers that he and Jan “hooked up”.

series.short_description: Michael coaches pompous Dwight on the finer art of public speaking after being named as Salesman of the Year.
series.name: Dwight’s Speech
series.description: Dwight Schrute is named Northeastern Pennsylvania Salesman of the Year and must make a speech at an association meeting at the Radisson Lackawanna Station Hotel, getting some assistance from Michael Scott.

series.short_description: A routine office day is changed when children come to Dunder Mifflin for “Take Your Daughter to Work Day.”
series.name: Take Your Daughter to Work Day
series.description: Michael Scott is frustrated that Take Your Daughter to Work Day will force him to tone down his office antics. Toby Flenderson and Stanley Hudson bring their daughters, Sasha and Melissa.

series.short_description: In celebration of his birthday, Michael makes a mandatory invite of the staff during the workday to go ice skating.
series.name: Michael’s Birthday
series.description: Michael Scott is excited to be celebrating his birthday, and tries to get the employees excited with him. Unfortunately for Michael, Dwight Schrute seems to be the only one joining in.

series.short_description: Dwight plays the role of Volunteer Sheriff after finding half a joint in the parking lot.
series.name: Drug Testing
series.description: Dwight Schrute finds half of a joint in the parking lot of the Scranton, Pennsylvania branch of the Dunder Mifflin Paper Company, and takes advantage of his volunteer sheriff deputy status to investigate its source.

series.short_description: When Michael takes over conflict resolution duties from HR, chaos ensues at Dunder Mifflin.
series.name: Conflict Resolution
series.description: When Michael Scott hears Oscar Martinez complaining about Angela Martin’s baby poster to Toby Flenderson, he intervenes and resolves the conflict himself by forcing his “solution” onto all parties.

series.short_description: The Dunder Mifflin crew holds a casino party at the warehouse and Michael has two dates.
series.name: Casino Night
series.description: Michael organizes a casino charity event in the warehouse, and unwittingly winds up with two dates for the evening, his boss Jan and his real-estate agent Carol. Jim, upset about Pam’s impending marriage to Roy.

series.short_description: Michael apologizes to Oscar, after he finds out he’s gay.
series.name: Gay Witch Hunt
series.description: Michael apologizes to Oscar, after he finds out he’s gay, for calling him a homosexual slur–but his apology outs Oscar to the entire office.

series.short_description: Michael and Dwight go to a convention in Philadelphia and run into Jim.
series.name: The Convention
series.description: Micheal and Dwight go to a convention in Philadelphia and run into Jim, and Michael becomes jealous of Jim’s relationship with his new boss.

series.short_description: Michael is in trouble once again as Jan busts him for declaring it’s “Movie Monday”.
series.name: The Coup
series.description: Michael is in trouble once again as Jan busts him for declaring it’s “Movie Monday” where everyone watches a movie and neglects work.

series.short_description: Michael takes on the role of office grief counselor when he learns that his old boss has died.
series.name: Grief Counseling
series.description: Michael takes on the role of office grief counselor when he learns that his old boss has died.

series.short_description: Dwight takes former temp Ryan to his beet farm to initiate Ryan to his new job at Dunder Mifflin.
series.name: Initiation
series.description: Dwight takes former temp Ryan to his beet farm to initiate Ryan to his new job at Dunder Mifflin.

series.short_description: Michael encourages the entire Scranton branch to support Kelly and attend a local celebration of Diwali.
series.name: Diwali
series.description: Michael encourages the entire Scranton branch to support Kelly and attend a local celebration of Diwali, the Hindu Festival of Lights.

series.short_description: When Jan tells Michael that the Scranton Branch will be shutting down.
series.name: Branch Closing
series.description: When Jan tells Michael that the Scranton Branch will be shutting down, Michael strives to keep his staff’s spirits up.

series.short_description: Jan informs Michael that the Scanton branch of Dunder Mifflin will be merging with the Stamford Branch.
series.name: The Merger
series.description: Jan informs Michael that the Scanton branch of Dunder Mifflin will be merging with the Stamford Branch.

series.short_description: Michael learns that one of the new employees at Dunder Mifflin Scranton has a criminal record.
series.name: The Convict
series.description: Michael learns that one of the new employees at Dunder Mifflin Scranton has a criminal record. Meanwhile, Jim helps Andy make a move on Pam.

series.short_description: Trouble among the members of the party planning committee results with the office having two competing Christmas parties.
series.name: A Benihana Christmas
series.description: Trouble among the members of the party planning committee results with the office having two competing Christmas parties.

series.short_description: Michael isn’t supposed to let anyone know that he and Jan went on vacation together in Jamaica.
series.name: Back From Vacation
series.description: Michael isn’t supposed to let anyone know that he and Jan went on vacation together in Jamaica.

series.short_description: Dwight does a favor for Angela to keep her from getting in trouble.
series.name: Traveling Salesmen
series.description: Dwight does a favor for Angela to keep her from getting in trouble. Andy finds out and uses it against him to get in tighter with Michael.

series.short_description: Andy does the impossible–he makes everyone in the office miss Dwight.
series.name: The Return
series.description: Andy does the impossible–he makes everyone in the office miss Dwight, who is forced to take a job at Staples.

series.short_description: Michael asks Jim to get a male stripper for Phyllis’s office bachelorette party.
series.name: Ben Franklin
series.description: Michael asks Jim to get a male stripper for Phyllis’s office bachelorette party, but he gets a Ben Franklin impersonator instead.

series.short_description: Michael exaggerates the importance of his small role in Phyllis’s wedding and makes an ass out of himself.
series.name: Phyllis’ Wedding
series.description: Michael exaggerates the importance of his small role in Phyllis’s wedding and makes an ass out of himself.

series.short_description: Michael is a guest speaker for Ryan’s business class.
series.name: Business School
series.description: Michael is a guest speaker for Ryan’s business class, but they have a falling-out after Michael finds out that Ryan spoke negatively about Dunder Mifflin.

series.short_description: While Michael and Jan go to their first Dunder Mifflin outing as an official couple.
series.name: Cocktails
series.description: While Michael and Jan go to their first Dunder-Mifflin outing as an official couple, the office workers left behind go out for happy hour.

series.short_description: Dwight saves Jim from an attack by Roy, but Dwight won’t allow Jim to thank him for it.
series.name: The Negotiation
series.description: Dwight saves Jim from an attack by Roy, but Dwight won’t allow Jim to thank him for it. Meanwhile, Darryl asks Michael for a pay raise.

series.short_description: Andy returns to the office after weeks of anger management training.
series.name: Safety Training
series.description: Andy returns to the office after weeks of anger management training, determined to make a fresh start with all the Dunder-Mifflin employees.

series.short_description: Michael tries to be proactive during a watermark crisis, but only makes the situation worse.
series.name: Product Recall
series.description: Michael tries to be proactive during a watermark crisis, but only makes the situation worse.

series.short_description: Phyllis gets flashed in the parking lot, and Dwight goes all out to secure the premises.
series.name: Women’s Appreciation
series.description: Phyllis gets flashed in the parking lot, and Dwight goes all out to secure the premises.

series.short_description: Michael uses “beach day” at Dunder-Mifflin to find out which employee would be his most capable replacement.
series.name: Beach Games
series.description: Michael uses “beach day” at Dunder-Mifflin to find out which employee would be his most capable replacement.

series.short_description: Michael appoints Dwight as regional manager, anticipating that he will receive the job at corporate.
series.name: The Job
series.description: Michael appoints Dwight as regional manager, anticipating that he will receive the job at corporate.

series.short_description: Michael feels threatened when Ryan returns to the Scranton.
series.name: Fun Run
series.description: Michael accidentally runs over Meridith in the parking lot, and his guilt causes him to organize a 5-K run for her.

series.short_description: Michael accidentally runs over Meridith in the parking lot.
series.name: Dunder Mifflin Infinity
series.description: Michael feels threatened when Ryan returns to the Scranton office to share his ideas about the future of Dunder Mifflin.

series.short_description: The Dunder Mifflin Infinity website is launching.
series.name: Launch Party
series.description: The Dunder Mifflin Infinity website is launching and Michael is excited about going to the big launch party in New York.

series.short_description: Michael confronts his growing debt every way he can.
series.name: Money
series.description: As Jan renovates the condo, Michael confronts his growing debt every way he can, which includes pressuring his employees for a loan.

series.short_description: Michael tries to make a local Dunder Mifflin commercial.
series.name: Local Ad
series.description: Michael tries to make a local Dunder Mifflin commercial that is better than the one the professional ad agency made for them.

series.short_description: Michael and Dwight try to play a prank on Karen.
series.name: Branch Wars
series.description: Michael and Dwight try to play a prank on Karen, who is now manager of the Utica branch, after she tries to steal Stanley from the Scranton office.

series.short_description: Michael isn’t invited to a camping trip with Ryan.
series.name: Survivor Man
series.description: After Michael isn’t invited to a camping trip with Ryan, he sets out to prove that he can brave it out in the wilderness by himself.

series.short_description: Michael is put in an awkward position when Jan sues Dunder Mifflin.
series.name: The Deposition
series.description: Michael is put in an awkward position when Jan sues Dunder-Mifflin for wrongful termination and he is deposed as a witness.

series.short_description: Michael invites Jim and Pam and Andy and Angela to a couples-only dinner party.
series.name: Dinner Party
series.description: Michael invites Jim, Pam, Andy and Angela to a couples-only dinner party, which makes Dwight very jealous.

series.short_description: Kevin and Andy team up to reclaim the stolen Dunder Mifflin parking spaces.
series.name: Chair Model
series.description: Kevin and Andy team up to reclaim the stolen Dunder-Mifflin parking spaces, which forces them into a showdown with the other five bosses.

series.short_description: Michael and Dwight go to New York to party with Ryan.
series.name: Night Out
series.description: Michael and Dwight go to New York to party with Ryan, who is having lots of personal and professional problems.

series.short_description: Michael tries to figure out how to respond to Stanley’s insubordination.
series.name: Did I Stutter?
series.description: Michael tries to figure out how to respond to Stanley’s insubordination during a meeting.

series.short_description: Dunder-Mifflin participates in a high school job fair.
series.name: Job Fair
series.description: Dunder-Mifflin participates in a high school job fair, but few students are interested. Jim, Andy, and Kevin play a round of golf with a prospective client.

series.short_description: Michael throws an extravagant going-away party for Toby.
series.name: Goodbye, Toby
series.description: Michael throws an extravagant going-away party for Toby, and falls in love with the woman who is replacing him.

series.short_description: Michael tries to motivate the Scranton branch to lose weight as part of an interoffice competition.
series.name: Weight Loss
series.description: Michael tries to motivate the Scranton branch to lose weight as part of an interoffice competition.

series.short_description: A confession at an H.R. business ethics seminar leads to a dispute between Michael and Holly.
series.name: Business Ethics
series.description: A confession at an H.R. business ethics seminar leads to a dispute between Michael and Holly over whether Meredith should be fired.

series.short_description: After planning an office baby shower for Jan, Michael is upset when he finds out that she had the baby without him.
series.name: Baby Shower
series.description: After planning an office baby shower for Jan, Michael is upset when he finds out that she had the baby without him.

series.short_description: Michael and Holly have sex for the first time.
series.name: Crime Aid
series.description: Michael and Holly have sex for the first time, and Michael holds a fund-raiser for the office after it is burglarized.

series.short_description: Holly is transferred back to New Hampshire after corporate discovers that she and Michael are dating.
series.name: Employee Transfer
series.description: Holly is transferred back to New Hampshire after corporate discovers that she and Michael are dating.

series.short_description: Dwight and Jim believe that something is suspicious about their low customer performance ratings.
series.name: Customer Survey
series.description: Dwight and Jim believe that something is suspicious about their low customer performance ratings.

series.short_description: David Wallace sends Michael on a business trip to Winnipeg.
series.name: Business Trip
series.description: David Wallace sends Michael on a business trip to Winnipeg to help him forget about Holly’s transfer to Nashua.

series.short_description: When Michael discovers that corporate has brought back Toby to replace Holly.
series.name: Frame Toby
series.description: When Michael discovers that corporate has brought back Toby to replace Holly, he tries to frame him with drugs to get him fired.

series.short_description: Michael has to spend the office surplus by they end of the day.
series.name: The Surplus
series.description: Michael has to spend the office surplus by they end of the day, but he can’t decide between a copier or new chairs.

series.short_description: Phyllis blackmails Angela into doing the work for the Christmas party.
series.name: Moroccan Christmas
series.description: Phyllis blackmails Angela into doing the work for the Christmas party, which Michael turns into an intervention after Meredith gets drunk.

series.short_description: Moments before he leaves for New York for a meeting with David Wallace.
series.name: The Duel
series.description: Moments before he leaves for New York for a meeting with David Wallace, Michael tells Andy that Angela and Dwight are seeing each other.

series.short_description: Michael’s conscience gets the best of him after he and Dwight go undercover to scout a family-run competitor.
series.name: Prince Family Paper
series.description: Michael’s conscience gets the best of him after he and Dwight go undercover to scout a family-run competitor.

series.short_description: Dwight’s too-realistic fire alarm gives Stanley a heart attack.
series.name: Stress Relief
series.description: Dwight’s too-realistic fire alarm gives Stanley a heart attack. When he returns, Michael learns that he is the cause of Stanley’s stress.

series.short_description: Michael and Pam discover that Jim’s ex-girlfriend Karen is pregnant.
series.name: Lecture Circuit: Part 1
series.description: While on lecture tour to other Dunder Mifflin branches, Michael and Pam discover that Jim’s ex-girlfriend Karen is pregnant.

series.short_description: Jim and Dwight try to come up with a theme for Kelly’s birthday party.
series.name: Lecture Circuit: Part 2
series.description: Michael and Pam go to Nashua and discover that Holly has a new boyfriend. At the office, Jim and Dwight try to come up with a theme for Kelly’s birthday.

series.short_description: Michael holds a lonely hearts party on Valentine’s Day at the office.
series.name: Blood Drive
series.description: Michael holds a lonely hearts party on Valentine’s Day at the office, hoping that he will run into a woman he met earlier that day at a blood drive.

series.short_description: Michael asks Dwight to be the scapegoat for one of his business ideas.
series.name: Golden Ticket
series.description: Michael asks Dwight to be the scapegoat for one of his business ideas that backfired badly on him.

series.short_description: Michael gets upset when he gets a new boss to act as a buffer between him and David Wallace.
series.name: New Boss
series.description: As Michael prepares to leave Dunder Mifflin, he announces that he will form his own paper company. Will anybody join him?

series.short_description: Michael prepares to leave Dunder Mifflin.
series.name: Two Weeks
series.description: Michael tries to motivate the Scranton branch to lose weight as part of an interoffice competition.

series.short_description: Michael and Pam begin their first day as the Michael Scott Paper Company.
series.name: Dream Team
series.description: Michael and Pam begin their first day as the Michael Scott Paper Company begins putting together the rest of the staff.

series.short_description: Tension and disillusionment begin to emerge as Michael, Pam, and Ryan move the Michael Scott Paper Company.
series.name: Michael Scott Paper Company
series.description: Tension and disillusionment begin to emerge as Michael, Pam, and Ryan move the Michael Scott Paper Company into a cramped “workspace”.

series.short_description: Dwight chooses loyalty to Dunder Mifflin over loyalty to Michael.
series.name: Heavy Competition
series.description: Dwight chooses loyalty to Dunder Mifflin over loyalty to Michael, which leads to a bitter battle between Michael and Dwight.

series.short_description: The Michael Scott Paper Company is gaining clients by offering lower prices than Dunder Mifflin.
series.name: Broke
series.description: The Michael Scott Paper Company is gaining clients by by offering lower prices than Dunder Mifflin, but is going broke in the process.

series.short_description: Michael returns to Dunder Mifflin and brings Ryan and Pam in as salespeople.
series.name: Casual Friday
series.description: Michael returns to Dunder Mifflin and brings Ryan and Pam in as salespeople, but the existing salespeople demand that Michael return the clients.

series.short_description: Michael tries to create a place to escape from work in the storage room.
series.name: Cafe Disco
series.description: Michael tries to create a place to escape from work in the storage room that used to house the Michael Scott Paper Company.

series.short_description: Michael runs into Holly at the company picnic.
series.name: Company Picnic
series.description: Michael runs into Holly at the company picnic, and the two of them accidentally reveal that the Buffalo branch is closing down. =

series.short_description: Michael spreads a bunch of lies about everyone.
series.name: Gossip
series.description: Michael feels left out as the rest of the office gossips about the summer interns.

series.short_description: Michael sabotages Jim’s efforts at getting a promotion.
series.name: The Meeting
series.description: The recession hits Dunder Mifflin and Dwight hits his breaking point with Jim.

series.short_description: Jim discovers just how hard being the boss can be.
series.name: The Promotion
series.description: Dwight reaches his breaking point with Jim and looks to the rest of the office for allies.

series.short_description: The Office travels to Niagara Falls to celebrate a wedding.
series.name: Niagara
series.description: Jim and Pam take the office to the falls for a wedding to remember.

series.short_description: Michael meets with an insurance salesman that visits the office.
series.name: Mafia
series.description: Michael suspects an insurance salesman is part of the mafia and enlists the help of Andy and Dwight to find out.

series.short_description: Jim and Pam return from their honeymoon and learn, to their horror, someone is dating Pam’s mom.
series.name: The Lover
series.description: Michael’s got a new love interest and does his best to keep her identity a secret.

series.short_description: Michael is upset when he becomes the butt of all the office jokes after he falls in a koi pond.
series.name: Koi Pond
series.description: It’s Halloween and the office plans a haunted house for children in the community.

series.short_description: Michael sparks more anger from Pam when he breaks up with her mom.
series.name: Double Date
series.description: Jim and Pam are forced to go on an uncomfortable double date with Michael and Pam’s mother.

series.short_description: The entire office is preoccupied about rumors of Dunder Mifflin’s bankruptcy.
series.name: Murder
series.description: Michael’s world is rocked by troubling rumors about Dunder Mifflin; Andy attempts to court Erin.

series.short_description: Michael speaks out of line at the Dunder Mifflin shareholders meeting.
series.name: Shareholder Meeting
series.description: Michael discovers he’s going to be honored by David Wallace in New York and brings Dwight, Andy, and Oscar along for the ride.

series.short_description: 10 years ago, Michael promised a group of 3rd graders he would pay for their college tuition.
series.name: Scott’s Tots
series.description: Michael is forced to face the music when a promise he made to a class of third graders ten years ago comes back to haunt him.

series.short_description: Michael gets upset when Jim promises Phyllis that she can be the office Santa.
series.name: Secret Santa
series.description: Michael is outraged when Jim allows Phyllis to play Santa at this year’s office holiday party.

series.short_description: A banker representing a potential buyer comes to the Scranton branch to interview the H.R. department.
series.name: The Banker
series.description: When a potential buyer shows up at Dunder Mifflin, Michael thinks back on all the good times in the office.

series.short_description: Michael hates the changes that Dunder Mifflin’s new owner is implementing.
series.name: Sabre
series.description: Michael adjusts to the news that Dunder Mifflin has been bought by a new company, Sabre.

series.short_description: Sabre’s CEO wants the Scranton branch to have one manager.
series.name: Manager and Salesman
series.description: The office prepares for their first visit from Sabre CEO Jo Bennett..

series.short_description: Pam goes into labor and Jim is ready to take her to the hospital.
series.name: The Delivery: Part 1
series.description: The office help Pam and Jim prepare for the birth of their baby. (Part 1)

series.short_description: After the baby is born, Pam has trouble getting the baby to breastfeed.
series.name: The Delivery: Part 2
series.description: Dwight decides he wants a baby of his own. (Part 2)

series.short_description: It’s St. Patrick’s Day, and the CEO forces the office to work late.
series.name: St. Patrick’s Day
series.description: Michael is upset when despite all his efforts he can’t get Jo to like him.

series.short_description: When the sales staff begins trying to boss around everyone in the office.
series.name: New Leads
series.description: When the sales staff lets Sabre’s new “sales is king” policy go to their heads, Michael hides their new, prized leads.

series.short_description: Oscar gets everybody in the office to go to Happy Hour.
series.name: Happy Hour
series.description: The Dunder Mifflin gang decides to plan a happy hour, but things go awry when Michael almost gets thrown out of the bar.

series.short_description: Michael creates problems for Andy on Secretary’s Day.
series.name: Secretary’s Day
series.description: Andy pulls out all the stops to make sure Erin’s Secretary’s Day is one she’ll never forget.

series.short_description: Michael is hopeful that a potential client is interested in him.
series.name: Body Language
series.description: Michael gets wildly confused when trying to read a female client’s body language.

series.short_description: Michael becomes convinced that Donna is having an affair.
series.name: The Cover-Up
series.description: Michael suspects Donna is cheating on him.

series.short_description: Michael continues to see Donna even after learning she’s married.
series.name: The Chump
series.description: Michael continues to date Donna even though she has a husband.

series.short_description: Jo comes to the Scranton branch to find the whistle-blower.
series.name: Whistleblower
series.description: Jo flies up from Florida to find out who leaked the story of Sabre’s faulty printers.

series.short_description: Everybody demands that Michael fire the new office assistant.
series.name: Nepotism
series.description: Michael refuses to fire the new office assistant after everyone complains about his bad attitude.

series.short_description: Michael is forced to go through counseling with Toby
series.name: Counseling
series.description: Corporate makes Michael partake in counseling sessions in the office with Toby.

series.short_description: Andy invites the entire office to watch him in the production of “Sweeney Todd”.
series.name: Andy’s Play
series.description: Andy hopes to impress Erin when he is cast in the local production of “Sweeney Todd.”

series.short_description: A herpes scare causes Michael to get back in touch with his ex-girlfriends.
series.name: Sex Ed
series.description: A medical scare forces Michael to contact all of his ex-girlfriends including Jan and Holly.

series.short_description: Michael organizes a sting operation to find out the secrets of a rival paper company’s salesman.
series.name: The Sting
series.description: Dwight, Michael and Jim team up to spy on their rival salesman while Andy, Darryl and Kevin decide to start a band.

series.short_description: It’s Halloween at Dunder Mifflin.
series.name: Costume Contest
series.description: A Halloween costume contest in the office has employees vying for the grand prize of a coupon book.

series.short_description: Michael becomes upset over the lack of family-like unity between himself and his employees.
series.name: Christening
series.description: Pam and Jim prepare for Cece’s baptism. When Cece goes missing, Jim fears Angela has taken her.

series.short_description: Michael sabotages Erin’s “Glee” viewing party.
series.name: Viewing Party
series.description: Michael attempts to sabotage Gabe’s viewing party.

series.short_description: Some co-workers who invested in Ryan’s Internet venture want him to sell.
series.name: WUPHF.com
series.description: Ryan gets the office invested in his internet start-up company, WUPHF.com.

series.short_description: Pam stands up to Dwight when he makes cutbacks to save money.
series.name: China
series.description: Oscar and Michael battle over who’s smarter, while Pam takes a stand against Dwight and his way of running the office building.

series.short_description: Michael throws an elaborate Christmas party.
series.name: Classy Christmas, Part 1
series.description: When Toby gets called into jury duty, he alerts the office that Holly will be taking over his HR duties.

series.short_description: Michael’s disappointed when he learns that Holly still has a boyfriend.
series.name: Classy Christmas, Part 2
series.description: Angela is still smitten with her new beau Robert, a state senator she met at Dwight’s hay place.

series.short_description: Michael gets upset when Holly returns from the holidays without an engagement ring.
series.name: Ultimatum
series.description: When Holly returns to work, the office wants to know whether she got engaged over New Year’s or not.

series.short_description: Andy tries to host a small business seminar at the office.
series.name: The Seminar
series.description: After Andy’s sales numbers come in low, he hosts his own seminar in Dunder Mifflin’s conference room.

series.short_description: Jim gets an emergency phone call from Helene.
series.name: The Search
series.description: Dwight, Erin and Holly go on a search for Michael when he goes missing.

series.short_description: It’s Valentine’s Day, and the office is fed up with Michael and Holly’s PDA.
series.name: PDA
series.description: It’s Valentine’s Day in the office and everyone is getting sick and tired of Michael and Holly’s PDAs.

series.short_description: Michael finally finishes his movie “Threat Level Midnight”.
series.name: Threat Level Midnight
series.description: Michael finally screens his epic film masterpiece “Threat Level Midnight” for the office – but Holly reacts poorly.

series.short_description: Everyone is up in arms after Michael convinces Holly to give Todd Packer an office job.
series.name: Todd Packer
series.description: Michael’s favorite Dunder Mifflin traveling salesman, Todd Packer, shows up at the office wanting a desk job.

series.short_description: Michael plans to propose to Holly.
series.name: Garage Sale
series.description: Michael finally pops the question to Holly while the office holds a garage sale in the warehouse.

series.short_description: Michael makes fast friends with the man coming in to replace him.
series.name: Training Day
series.description: As Michael trains his replacement, the staffers – except for an apathetic Dwight – scramble to impress the new manager.

series.short_description: Michael hosts his final “Dundies” as the boss.
series.name: Michael’s Last Dundies
series.description: In his final days on the job, Michael trains Deangelo to take over hosting the Dundie Awards.

series.short_description: The office gets ready for Michael’s final day at Dunder Mifflin.
series.name: Goodbye Michael Scott
series.description: Michael, about to leave for Colorado, wants a day without drama to say his goodbyes to each co-worker.

series.short_description: Tensions rise and feelings are hurt when Deangelo creates an “inner circle”.
series.name: The Inner Circle
series.description: When Deangelo creates an “Inner Circle” of only men, the women of the office object to his sexist ways.

series.short_description: Dwight becomes acting manager at the Scranton branch.
series.name: Dwight K. Schrute, (Acting) Manager
series.description: Dwight takes over for Deangelo and immediately begins applying his unique management style to Dunder Mifflin Sabre. Kathy Bates guest stars.

series.short_description: The Scranton branch puts together a search committee.
series.name: Search Committee, Part 1
series.description: Jim heads a search committee that interviews candidates, including Andy and Darryl. Meanwhile, Dwight tries to get back in the race.

series.short_description: Dwight demands an interview in spite of his gun accident.
series.name: Search Committee, Part 2
series.description: Jo Bennet from corporate has assigned Toby, Gabe and Jim as a task force to interview candidates for the manager position.

series.short_description: New Dunder Mifflin CEO Robert California arrives at the office.
series.name: The List
series.description: The staff is hit with a double whammy as Scranton gets a new regional manager and Robert California takes the helm of Dunder Mifflin Sabre as CEO.

series.short_description: Andy offers an incentive program to the sales staff.
series.name: The Incentive
series.description: Robert California wants to double sales growth, and Andy responds with an unusual incentive plan to motivate the team.

series.short_description: Darryl becomes depressed and demands to be fired.
series.name: Lotto
series.description: When the warehouse crew quits after winning the lotto, the team pitches in to keep Dunder Mifflin humming.

series.short_description: Andy claims to be throwing a garden party at Dwight’s farm to impress Robert California.
series.name: Garden Party
series.description: Trying to gain some respect from his family and new boss, Andy throws a garden party at Schrute Farms.

series.short_description: Erin is worried that she is about to get fired.
series.name: Spooked
series.description: Erin struggles to pull off the ultimate Halloween party, juggling the expectations of Robert California, Andy and the staff.

series.short_description: Dwight installs a “Doomsday Device” on the office computers.
series.name: Doomsday
series.description: Challenged to improve productivity and reduce errors by Robert California, Dwight develops an accountability booster program that threatens the office.

series.short_description: A pregnant and insecure Pam tries to prove that Jim is attracted to her temp replacement.
series.name: Pam’s Replacement
series.description: Pam’s convinced her temp replacement is the apple of Jim’s eye; Robert California has a musical proposition for Andy, Darryl and Kevin.

series.short_description: Andy decides to motivate and inspire everyone by taking them on a field trip to Gettysburg.
series.name: Gettysburg
series.description: Andy tries to fire up the team with a trip to Gettysburg; Robert California challenges the team to think way outside the box.

series.short_description: Robert brings his wife to the office so that she can find a job.
series.name: Mrs. California
series.description: Andy’s in a tough spot when Robert California sends him mixed messages about hiring his wife.

series.short_description: Andy tries to make this year’s Christmas the best ever.
series.name: Christmas Wishes
series.description: Andy wants to make everyone’s Christmas wishes come true – no matter how distraught they are.

series.short_description: Andy hopes to make up for a sales deficiency by entering and winning a bar trivia competition.
series.name: Trivia
series.description: Pressed to boost the bottom line, Andy finds a novel way to improve sales, while Dwight explores corporate opportunities outside Scranton.

series.short_description: Robert throws a party for the Dunder Mifflin staff.
series.name: Pool Party
series.description: Robert invites the staff to his house for one last party before the home goes up for sale.

series.short_description: Jim gets caught in a lie about his week of “jury duty”.
series.name: Jury Duty
series.description: Jim comes under fire when the office realizes he skipped work by faking jury duty to spend time with Pam and the new baby.

series.short_description: Andy puts Dwight in charge of a special project in Tallahassee.
series.name: Special Project
series.description: Dwight is recruited to lead a team to head to Florida to create a chain of Sabre retail stores.

series.short_description: Dwight refuses to let appendicitis get in the way of leading his new team in Tallahassee.
series.name: Tallahassee
series.description: Dwight takes his team to Tallahassee to conceive a new chain of Sabre retail stores.

series.short_description: Dwight and Todd Packer try to romance Nellie to get the VP position.
series.name: After Hours
series.description: Nellie pits Packer against Dwight for the VP job; Jim fends off an amorous intruder while Andy works the Scranton team overtime.

series.short_description: Dwight and his team get ready for the grand opening of the Sabre Store.
series.name: Test the Store
series.description: Dwight plans an impressive presentation for the Sabre store. Andy suffers an embarrassing injury.

series.short_description: Jim tries to warn Dwight that he’s going to be fired after Robert rejects the Sabre Store idea.
series.name: Last Day in Florida
series.description: Jim tries to head off a career disaster for Dwight; Andy learns Erin’s not returning to Scranton.

series.short_description: Andy goes to Tallahassee to tell Erin that he loves her.
series.name: Get the Girl
series.description: As Andy heads south to Florida to sweep Erin off her feet, Nellie makes herself at home in his office in Scranton.

series.short_description: Andy tries to break up with his girlfriend after going to Florida.
series.name: Welcome Party
series.description: As Erin and Andy plot how he should break up with Jessica, Robert California orders the office to throw a welcome party for Nellie.

series.short_description: Andy and Erin return to Dunder Mifflin.
series.name: Angry Andy
series.description: Andy’s job – and manhood – are called into question as he returns with Erin to Scranton.

series.short_description: Andy confronts Robert for the first time after losing the manager position.
series.name: Fundraiser
series.description: Unemployed Andy crashes a fundraiser for the Senator – and ends up the unlikely owner of a dozen disabled dogs.

series.short_description: Dwight and Jim fight with the Syracuse over a client.
series.name: Turf War
series.description: A drunken Robert California closes a branch, igniting a sales war.

series.short_description: Andy launches a plan to get revenge on the Scranton branch.
series.name: Free Family Portrait Studio
series.description: Dwight raises suspicions by offering free portraits; Andy returns with some self-satisfying news.

series.short_description: Dwight and Jim are intimidated by the office’s newest additions.
series.name: New Guys
series.description: The office has two new faces, Clark and Pete. When Clark gets the nickname “the New Dwight” and Peter becomes “the New Jim,” it causes existential crises on the part of both Dwight and Jim.

series.short_description: Jim and Pam wonder if they still have any secrets they’re hiding from each other.
series.name: Roy’s Wedding
series.description: Jim and Pam get a surprising invitation to Roy’s wedding only to discover that a lot has changed with Roy. Meanwhile, back at the office, Andy and Erin prepare for a Dwight Jr’s audition and someone tries to interfere.

series.short_description: Nellie plays a trick on Andy after researching his ancestry.
series.name: Andy’s Ancestry
series.description: Andy discovers that he may be a distant relative of Michelle Obama. His elation turns to embarrassment after his employees jump to some negative conclusions about his family. Meanwhile, Pam bonds with Nellie.

series.short_description: Dwight rents a bus and sets up the office inside.
series.name: Work Bus
series.description: Dwight rents a bus for the office staff to temporarily work in. In an episode that could’ve been gimmicky (let’s put ’em on a bus!), the characters made this a worthwhile venture.

series.short_description: On Halloween, the Cornell a Capella group pays a visit to Andy.
series.name: Here Comes Treble
series.description: After inviting his former college a cappella group, Here Comes Treble, to perform for the office during Halloween, Andy gets angry when he hears that his college friend Broccoli Rob is telling a different story about the group.

series.short_description: Andy has one last chance to captain the family boat.
series.name: The Boat
series.description: Andy must help his family when his dad loses all of their money. Meanwhile, Dwight is a guest on a radio show, and his co-workers call in to bother him. Kevin learns a secret about Oscar.

series.short_description: The office trains Dwight to sell to a female client without being offensive.
series.name: The Whale
series.description: In order to land the Scranton White Pages as a client, Dwight must confront his inability to speak to women; Jim’s teleconference with his business partners is subject to distraction; Angela and Oscar follow Senator Lipton to the gym; the office stages a mustache contest.

series.short_description: Angela orders a hit on Oscar for cheating with her husband.
series.name: The Target
series.description: Angela goes to Dwight for help when she learns that her husband is having an affair with Oscar. Stanley and Phyllis take advantage of Jim when he needs a favor, and Pete distracts Pam as she begins painting her mural.

series.short_description: Dwight puts together a Pennsylvania Dutch-themed office Christmas party.
series.name: Dwight Christmas
series.description: Erin checks the calendar and realizes that the office’s annual Christmas party is today, but no one has made any plans for it. Wanting a party everyone suggests ideas for a theme: tropical, topless, etc.

series.short_description: Pam causes a lice outbreak but lets Meredith take the blame.
series.name: Lice
series.description: Pam accidentally brings lice into the office and lets Meredith take the fall, while Dwight vows to destroy the parasites. Meanwhile, Jim has a fantastic day in Philly wooing a potential business associate.

series.short_description: Dwight and Clark pose as father and son to get an account.
series.name: Suit Warehouse
series.description: Clark returns from his sex jaunt with Jan and gifts the office with a new espresso maker, which everyone abuses. Dwight takes him to sell a father – son suit warehouse.

series.short_description: Dwight tries to keep Daryl from leaving Dunder Mifflin.
series.name: Customer Loyalty
series.description: Jim is forced to miss Cece’s first recital after a major investor exits his company. Dwight tries to prevent Darryl from leaving the office. Nellie accidentally outs Pete and Erin.

series.short_description: Dwight gets to hire a new salesman to replace Jim.
series.name: Junior Salesman
series.description: Dunder Mifflin CEO David Wallace tasks Dwight with finding a part-time replacement for Jim; Dwight in turns enlists several of his close friends, including his cousin Mose.

series.short_description: Pam tries to find out who vandalized her mural.
series.name: Vandalism
series.description: Someone vandalizes Pam’s warehouse mural. Distraught, she seeks the help of Dwight and Nellie, who both eagerly help her track down the vandal. Meanwhile, in their Philadelphia apartment, Darryl is uncomfortable with Jim’s uncleanliness.

series.short_description: Andy returns after three months to an angry office.
series.name: Couples Discount
series.description: The office pairs into couples so that they may all be able to take advantage of a Valentine’s Day discount at a mini-mall. After Andy returns from his boat trip, Erin decides that she is going to break up with him.

series.short_description: Andy finds out that Erin dumped him for Pete.
series.name: Moving On
series.description: Pam interviews for a job in Philadelphia, but her potential manager reminds her of her former boss, Michael Scott. Dwight acquires the help of Angela in order to give his elderly Aunt Shirley a bath.

series.short_description: Dwight’s brother and sister return to the farm.
series.name: The Farm
series.description: Oscar attends the funeral of Dwight’s Aunt Shirley at Schrute Farms. Dwight’s sister Fannie and brother Jeb also attend and Shirley stipulates in her will that they are set to inherit her farm only if they choose to live and work it themselves.

series.short_description: Dwight considers a business venture with his girlfriend’s family.
series.name: Promos
series.description: Everyone in the office is excited when international promos for the documentary surface, but are soon horrified to discover how much candid filming has taken place.

series.short_description: Dwight shoots Stanley with a bull tranquilizer.
series.name: Stairmageddon
series.description: The elevators are under maintenance and the office workers have to walk up the stairs, a situation everyone deems the “Stairmageddon”. Exhausted after climbing the stairs, Stanley refuses to go back down in order to close a sale with one of their bigger clients.

series.short_description: The employees hold a paper airplane competition.
series.name: Paper Airplane
series.description: Dwight and Angela compete in an office-wide paper airplane contest where the winner gets a prize. A talent agent named Carla Fern helps Andy with his first acting role. Jim and Pam’s new couples counseling skills are unleashed.

series.short_description: Dwight becomes regional manager after Andy quits his job.
series.name: Livin’ the Dream
series.description: Andy tells David Wallace that he is leaving Dunder Mifflin to pursue acting. Dwight has his black belt ceremony with his new sensei at the office during lunch.

series.short_description: Dwight prepares for a marriage proposal.
series.name: A.A.R.M.
series.description: As the office staff gets ready for the premier of their documentary, Jim and Dwight fill the position for the Assistant to the Assistant Regional Manager. Andy auditions for the reality TV show “The Next Great A Cappella Sensation.

series.short_description: Dunder Mifflin employees past and present reunite for a panel discussion.
series.name: Finale
series.description: Months after the documentary airs, office staffers from the past and present gather for a wedding and a final round of interviews.
